Row.Text: One extra Wildcard policy slot in any government. +5% [ICON_Culture] Culture per city-state you are the Suzerain of. +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +1 [ICON_Science] Science from international [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes.

Automatically receive the final Great Prophet when the next-to-last one is claimed (if you have not earned a Great Prophet already). Combat units have a bonus of +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength against players following other Religions. Opposing civilizations receive double the war weariness for fighting against Zelda.

Rainforest tiles provide +1 adjacency bonus for Campus, Commercial Hub, Holy Site, and Theater Square districts. Rainforest tiles provide +1 [ICON_Housing] Housing for Neighborhoods built adjacent to them. All units gains additional +5 [ICON_Strength] when fighting in Forest or Jungle. Units heal faster in forest or jungles.

All units are cannot be seen in the woods or jungle unless they are adjacent to it. +1 Gold[ICON_Gold] in the Commercial Hubs next to Forests. All units can move through Woods and Rainforest without [ICON_Movement] Movement penalty.

All districts receive an additional standard adjacency bonus for being adjacent to another district. Each city can build one more district than usual (exceeding the normal limit based on [ICON_Citizen] Population).

All cities start with an additional City Center building. (Starts with a Monument building in the Ancient era). All their units do not suffer combat penalties when damaged. Accumulate 60% less war weariness than usual.

All units receive +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking wounded units. Unit maintenance cost reduced by 2 Gold per turn, per unit. Gains an extra Morannon Orc when trained one. Accumulate 60% less war weariness than usual.
Additional Military policy slot. Combat victories provide [ICON_Faith] Faith and [ICON_Gold] Gold equal to 50% of the [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength of the defeated unit.

+30% [ICON_Production] Production towards districts and wonders if placed next to a River. Allows coastal raiding for all naval melee units. Units gain the ability to enter Ocean tiles after researching the Shipbuilding technology. Naval melee units heal in neutral territory. Units ignore additional [ICON_Movement] Movement costs from embarking and disembarking.

Land units receive +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in land tiles adjacent to Coast; naval units receive +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in shallow water tiles. Builds Encampment, Holy Site and Theater Square districts in half the time.

Builders receive an additional charge. Industrials Zones gains 1 [ICON_Production] Production and the Commercial Hubs gains 1 [ICON_Gold] Gold if they are next to a Mountain. All mines gives +1 [ICON_Food] Food.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength against Melee units. All cities you found or conquer start with a Trading Post.

Commercial Hubs gives 1 [ICON_Gold] Gold and 1 [ICON_Food] Food per adjacency to Desert or Desert Hills. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in Desert. Extra territory upon founding cities. Oasis tiles provide +2 [ICON_Food] Food and +1 [ICON_Culture] to City Center.

Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to other civilizations provide +4 [ICON_Gold] Gold for Riju. Other civilizations' [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to Riju provide +2 [ICON_Food] Food for them and +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold and +2 [ICON_Food] Food for Riju.

All cities you found or conquer start with a Trading Post. If in [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route range of your [ICON_Capital] Capital, they also start with a road to it. Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes earn +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold for passing through Trading Posts in your own cities.

Luxury resources in his territory provide an [ICON_Amenities] Amenity to 2 extra cities. Military units receive +1 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength for each different Luxury resource improved in Aztec lands.
Hyrule unique heavy cavalry unit. Does not suffer combat penalties when damaged.
Hyrule unique recon unit replace the Ranger. This unit heals every turn, even after moving or combat. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in your territory or adjacent to your territory.
Deku unique melee unit. +7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending in Woods, Jungle, Hills, or Marsh. Doesn't require Iron.
Deku unique ranged unit, replaces the Archer. Less attack than normal but +1 additional attack if unit has not moved.
Deku unique ranged unit, replaces the Crossbowman. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when in a district or fort.
Deku unique anti-cav unit. +7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending in Woods, Jungle, Hills, or Marsh.
Deku unique light cavalry unit. Faster if it starts in open terrain, doesn't require the Horses resource.
Deku unique light cavalry unit. -5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength for all adjacent enemy units.
Garo unique recon unit replace the Ranger. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength outside of own borders.
Ikana unique heavy cavalry unit. This unit heals every turn, even after moving or combat.
Monster unique anti-cavalry unit. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength against Melee units.
Monster unique melee unit. Reduced pillage cost.
Monster unique ranged unit. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength against damaged units.
Monster unique Medieval era light cavalry unit. +5 Combat Strength when fighting in Hills and can move over Hills faster.
Monster unique heavy cavalry unit. Does not suffer combat penalties when damaged.
Monster unique anti-cavalry unit. +7 [ICON_Strength]Combat Strength when attacking, and -7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending.
Monster unique ranged unit. Yields 50% of defeated units' [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength as [ICON_Science] Science on combat victory.
Zora unique anti-cavalry unit. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength if there is at least one adjacent Zora Spear unit.
Zora unique Medieval era light cavalry unit. Does not have any movement cross cost when crossing rivers.
Zora unique heavy cavalry unit. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when in your territory or adjacent to your territory.
Goron unique ranged unit. +7 [ICON_Strength]Combat Strength when attacking, and -7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending.
Goron unique ranged unit, replaces the Archer. Less attack than normal but +1 additional attack if unit has not moved.
Goron unique melee unit, replaces the Swordsman. +7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending vs. ranged attacks.
Goron unique anti-cavalry unit, replaces the Pikemen. Does not suffer combat penalties when damaged.
Goron unique light cavalry unit. Pushes defending enemy units back from their hex in any battle where they score more damage. Defenders that cannot retreat suffer additional damage.
Goron unique heavy cavalry unit. Can heal adjacent units.
Gerudo unique heavy cavalry unit. Faster if it starts in open terrain.
Gerudo unique melee unit. Recieve +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in land tiles adjacent to Coast.
Gerudo unique anti-cavalry unit. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when in your territory or adjacent to your territory.
Evil unique recon unit replace the Ranger. Can move after attacking if [ICON_Movement] Movement points remain.

Hyrule unique improvement. Gives +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +1 [ICON_Food] Food and +1 Housing. If next to a Pasture, gives additional +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture, +1 [ICON_Food] Food and +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold.
Ikana unique improvement. Gives +2 [ICON_Faith] Faith. If next to a Holy Siteas, gives additional +2 [ICON_Faith] Faith, +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture.
Zora unique improvement. Gives +2 [ICON_Faith] Faith. Adjacency bonus for rivers of +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith.
Goron unique improvement. Gives +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture. If next to a Mine or a Quarry, gives additional +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture, +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith.

Zora unique District for city growth. Replaces the Aqueduct district.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]It provides this city with a source of fresh water from an adjacent River, Lake, Oasis, or Mountain. Cities that do not yet have existing fresh water receive up to 6 [ICON_Housing] Housing. Cities that already have existing fresh water will instead get +2 [ICON_Housing] Housing. Must be built adjacent to the City Center. In either case, the Bath provides an additional bonus of +2 [ICON_Housing] Housing and +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith, additionaly +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture for River adjacency. Must be built adjacent to the City Center. Gives culture for each citizen.

Gerudo unique District that replace the Comercial Hub district which provides a large amount of [ICON_Gold] Gold and [ICON_GreatMerchant] Great Merchant points. +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold and +1 [ICON_Culture] for Oasis adjacency.
Hyrule unique Bulding that replace the Monument. +3 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith.
